job_tasks.phrase: Responsible for architecture design and maintenance of Next Generation Distributed Storage, including distributed block storage, object storage, file storage etc.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the design and maintenance of a storage platform, which involves building and integrating software components for distributed storage systems. This aligns with the definition of developing and integrating software applications.

job_tasks.phrase: Ensure the architecture to meet SDS (Software Defined Storage) scenarios, HCI scenarios and hybrid cloud scenarios.
job_tasks.justification: This task involves ensuring that the designed architecture supports specific deployment scenarios (Software Defined Storage, HCI, hybrid cloud), which is a core aspect of integrating and building software systems for various environments.

job_tasks.phrase: Responsible for the development of Reference Architectures and technology standards based on Infrastructure Building Blocks, that can be offered as services to our internal customers
job_tasks.justification: Developing reference architectures and technology standards for infrastructure building blocks that are offered as services is a software development task, focusing on creating reusable components and services.

job_tasks.phrase: Responsible for the design, implementation, security and availability of Storage, Backups and SAN infrastructure, based on business requirements while adhering to tight operations, security, and procedural models
job_tasks.justification: This involves the end-to-end design, implementation, and maintenance of infrastructure, which is a software development and integration responsibility, ensuring systems meet business and operational requirements.

job_tasks.phrase: Operate in complex, highly-secure, highly-available, operations-centric datacenter environments and interact with other technology domain experts as required, to build and maintain the Storage and Backups solutions in those datacenter environments
job_tasks.justification: Building and maintaining storage and backup solutions within datacenter environments, while interacting with other experts, falls under the umbrella of software development and integration, focusing on operational aspects of systems.

job_tasks.phrase: Responsible for complex provisioning, advanced maintenance, data replication, disaster recovery, data migration and documentation for our Storage and Backup environments
job_tasks.justification: These tasks (provisioning, maintenance, replication, DR, migration, documentation) are all integral to the lifecycle management and development of robust software infrastructure.

job_tasks.phrase: Write technical design and build documentation for storage infrastructure
job_tasks.justification: Writing technical documentation is a standard part of the software development lifecycle, ensuring clarity and maintainability of the developed infrastructure.

job_tasks.phrase: Responsible for technology strategy, engineering standards, methodologies, task-plans and best practices for Storage Engineering.
job_tasks.justification: Defining technology strategy, standards, and best practices for engineering is a high-level software development and architecture task, guiding the creation of robust systems.

job_tasks.phrase: Demonstrate a high level of technical expertise to support complex Storage & Backup devices, including SAN, NAS and Backup solutions across all tiers, under minimal supervision
job_tasks.justification: Supporting and maintaining complex storage devices and solutions, while requiring technical expertise, leans towards the operational and maintenance aspects of infrastructure, aligning with the 'Operations' part of the MLOps category, albeit in a non-ML context.

soft_skills.phrase: work with various engineering, devops and product management teams
soft_skills.justification: This phrase explicitly mentions working with different teams, which is a direct indicator of collaboration and communication skills.

soft_skills.phrase: interact with other technology domain experts as required
soft_skills.justification: Interacting with domain experts highlights the need for communication and collaboration to achieve shared goals.

soft_skills.phrase: Demonstrate a high level of technical expertise to support complex Storage & Backup devices, including SAN, NAS and Backup solutions across all tiers, under minimal supervision
soft_skills.justification: Supporting complex devices with minimal supervision implies a strong ability to troubleshoot and solve problems independently, demonstrating technical expertise and problem-solving skills.

soft_skills.phrase: Responsible for architecture design and maintenance of Next Generation Distributed Storage
soft_skills.justification: Taking responsibility for the architecture design and maintenance of a 'Next Generation' system indicates ownership and a drive to innovate or improve existing systems.

soft_skills.phrase: Responsible for technology strategy, engineering standards, methodologies, task-plans and best practices for Storage Engineering.
soft_skills.justification: Being responsible for technology strategy and best practices demonstrates ownership and a proactive approach to shaping the direction of the engineering efforts.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses entirely on traditional storage infrastructure engineering, including architecture design, implementation, maintenance, operations, and documentation. There is no mention of AI, ML, or Generative AI tasks or technologies. All identified tasks fall under 'Macro-Category A: Core Software Engineering', specifically '1.A.1. Software Development & Integration' and '1.A.2. Operations & MLOps (LLMOps)' (though the latter is applied in a non-ML context here). Therefore, the role is classified as a 'Software Engineer'.

confidence.reasoning: The job advertisement is very clear and specific about the responsibilities and technologies involved, which are exclusively related to storage infrastructure. There is no ambiguity or mention of AI/ML, making the classification straightforward.
